qas.question: To what religion is Boudhanath holy?
What do the Newars call Boudhanath?
What is Boudhanath called in Nepali?
How far is Boudhanath from Kathmandu in miles?
When did UNESCO make Boudhanath a World Heritage Site?

context: The Boudhanath, (also written Bouddhanath, Bodhnath, Baudhanath or the Khāsa Chaitya), is one of the holiest <a0_0>Buddhist<a0_0/> sites in Nepal, along with Swayambhu. It is a very popular tourist site. Boudhanath is known as <a1_0>Khāsti<a1_0/> by Newars and as <a2_0>Bauddha or Bodhnāth<a2_0/> by speakers of Nepali. Located about 11 km (<a3_0>7<a3_0/> mi) from the center and northeastern outskirts of Kathmandu, the stupa's massive mandala makes it one of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal. Boudhanath became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in <a4_0>1979<a4_0/>.
